name: (R) ESTAR HP Pt. FS (NG Furnace)
_description: ENERGY STAR air source heat pump (w/ cold climates specs as applicable) w/ original gas furnace backup

notes: Split system ducted (see Tables 2 (warm climates) and 3 (cold climates) in EPA source)
conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source)
split system conversion factors SEER2/SEER = 0.95, HSPF2/HSPF = 0.85 (see RESNET source)

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.1
source_data.author: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency

source_data.author: RESNET

source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Retail (new) and total installed (existing) cost for ENERGY STAR ASHPs in 2023
For new buildings, also add retail cost of typical gas furnace.

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average of the ENERGY STAR range

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

market_scaling_fractions_source.notes: Heating multiples were determined as proportion of total homes that have both cooling and heating systems in each BA climate zone. Cooling multiple of 49% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a cooling system (16,171 homes) where there is heating via natural gas other than steam/hot water (7,845 homes).
